title._content: French Reservists going to R.R. station in Paris  (LOC)

description._content: Bain News Service,, publisher. French Reservists going to R.R. station in Paris [between ca. 1914 and ca. 1915] 1 negative : glass ; 5 x 7 in. or smaller. Notes: Title from data provided by the Bain News Service on the negative. Photograph shows French reservist soldiers marching in front of the Brasserie Bougeneaux (9 Rue de Strasbourg), Paris, France, on their way to the Gare de l'Est, during World War I. (Source: Flickr Commons project, 2011 and similar Bain negative: 3200-14) Forms part of: George Grantham Bain Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: World War, 1914-1918. Paris Format: Glass negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print General information about the Bain Collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.ggbain Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.16963 Call Number: LC-B2- 3201-5
